verses.roman:
tataḥ pracaṇḍa-pavano
varṣāṇām adhikaṁ śatam
paraḥ sāṁvartako vāti
dhūmraṁ khaṁ rajasāvṛtam

synonyms: tataḥ—then; pracaṇḍa—terrible; pavanaḥ—a wind; varṣāṇām—of years; adhikam—more than; śatam—one hundred; paraḥ—great; sāmvartakaḥ—causing annihilation; vāti—blows; dhūmram—gray; kham—the sky; rajasā—with dust; āvṛtam—covered.
translation: A great and terrible wind of destruction will begin to blow for more than one hundred years, and the sky, covered with dust, will turn gray.
